Rift Patch 1.3 Waves of Madness - World Event Commentary

Rift Patch 1.3 Waves of Madness - World Event Commentary

Before the RIFT 1.3 coming out,we show something about World Event Commentary ,hope it could be helpful for you to enjoy the new Patch 1.3, also we offer the cheapest RIFT Platinum,if you want to Buy Rift Platinum,come here,ESTAR would be your best partner in RIFT.
Event Features
•Event specific major invasions
•New bosses and new monsters
•New currency and gear to purchase
•New collections
•New rifts (including underwater rifts)

Phase 1: From the Black Depths
The Abyssal are launching new rifts and invasions across the world. Visit Sanctum or Meridian to learn how you can help defend Telara and earn Rune King's Seals, which can be traded to obtain legendary items of the Runegard.Buy RIFT Gold.

The Abyssal are launching new rifts and invasions across the world. Visit Sanctum or Meridian to learn how you can help defend Telara and earn Rune King's Seals, which can be traded to obtain legendary items of the Runegard.Cheap Rift Gold,

This is the introduction phase to the event. Merchant and Runeguard NPCs will show up in Meridian and Sanctum informing the Ascended of their plight and offering great rewards for any aid.

A Clash of Power
In this event the Ascended must prevent the warring Water and Death invasions from tearing apart Moonshade Highlands during their feud. In the first part of this event two Massive Shade Idols and two Massive Tidal Cores will spawn. One of each will be placed on the eastern (Guardian side of the map) and western (Defiant side). They will quickly begin spewing out elite invasion forces that head directly towards Reclaimer's Hold.

The Ascended must defend Reclaimer's Hold while dealing with these massive footholds. Each foothold has over 2.2 million health and a continuous stream of invasions to help defend it. After all four footholds have been eradicated Warden of Corruption and Tidal Destroyer will spawn and head towards Reclaimer's Hold. Here they intend to destroy each other, but not before killing every dwarf and Ascended that happens to cross their paths.

With the Warden and Destroyer defeated all that is left is to collect your 25 Rune King's Seal and head towards the gates of Hammerknell!

Phase 2: Against the Storm
Jomaru has seized the steps of Hammerknell Fortress in Moonshade Highlands and is conducting a ritual to summon a powerful tempest. Close water rifts, defeat Abyssal invaders and destroy their Colossi across Telara to sever his connection to the Plane of WAter before the storm rips Telara apart.

This phase will introduce two new water rifts. One of them you must defend yourself against attacking waves of invaders. Each of these has new water rift scenery and rewards King's Seals.Buy Cheap Rift Platinum
Waves of Madness
This phase is very similar to a standard zone wide invasion event and begins with a zone wide announcement. The Ascended must defeat 45 of Jonaru's invasions and 14 of his rifts all while defending four wardstones spread throughout the zone (roughly two on the Defiant side and two on the Guardian side).

However, this event can spawn considerably more difficult rifts than a standard zone invasion. Expect to see minor rifts that have non elite mobs with 30,000+ health and bosses with 140,000+ health. The major rifts bosses can have near one million health.RIFT Plat
When all of the required invasions and rifts have been dealt with this zone wide message is heard:
Bloodtide Fanatic shouts, "Rally, my Abyssal brethren! Show these ascended the might of Akylios!"
Jonaru shouts, "You cannot stop the Abyssal from discovering the secrets of Hammerknell!"

The invasion objective will update with Defeat the Abyssal Invader. Two bosses will spawn in the Highlands. One is the Bloodtide Fanatic who has around one million health and does nothing special. The other spawn has a million health as well but after he dies Slaughter Jaw will spawn. Slaughter Jaw has nearly one and a half million health and does a lot of AoE damage.Buy Rift Plat
After slaying Slaughter Jaw, thank your healers, and collect your 25 Rune King's Seals.

Phase 3: Return of the Shade
The doors of Hammerknell are cracked and the horrors within now run rampant across Telara. Your only chance to end this nightmare is to collect Death Shards to charge an ancient Rune Cannon that can grant you entry into the Fortress. Collect this sourcestone by closing death rifts, defeating Endless invaders and completing Runic Descent. Deliver them to the Runeguard collectors scattered throughout the world.Rift Online Gold

During this event any Ascended who kill a death invasion, rift or run through Runic Descent will be given a buff called "Death Shard". With this buff go to Moonshade Highlands and you will find run cannons throughout the zone. Step on the platform near a cannon to add your shard to the cannon's total. When the cannon reaches 100 shards it will fire and destroy a shield protecting various mobs and rifts.

The Blight
This zone invasion is quite a treat. This event will start off with a zone announcement regarding the Cysts that have developed in Moonshade Highlands. The Ascended work together in defeating invasions in order to obtain a buff called "Shadefire Orb". With this buff an Ascended can stand on one of the cannon (Defiant) or catapult (Guardian) actuators and a shot will be fired at the Shade Cyst. Camps for both Defiant and Guardians can be found near each of the Cysts.

After 100 total shots have been fired at a given Cyst its barrier will drop. This will cause a Dread Stalker to spawn. The Stalker is level 39 and has near one million health, much like a typical Moonshade Highlands zone invasion boss.

After dispatching all three Cysts and Stalkers the event will complete and you will be rewarded with 25 Rune King's Seals.

Phase 4: A Light in the Dark
The death barrier has been shattered and the doors of Hammerknell Fortress in Moonshade Highlands are crumbling. Tear down the doors, if you are brave enough to face what lurks beyond.

Two large cannons can be found outside the gates to Hammerknell Fortress. The cannons must be used by the Ascended to break down the gates and gain entrance.

When the cannons fire the doors will crumble, but something was awaiting the intrusion. Murdantix emerges from the gates and Runeguard, Defiant, and Guardian must work together to fell the ancient beast.

Phase 5: A Celebration of Light
The dual threats of the Abyssal and the Endless have been quelled, for now. With the opening of the doors of Hammerknell Fortress, the Ascended seek glory and riches within its mysterious depths.

RIFT PTS Patch 1.3 In-Progress Notes No.4 - Build 6/18/11

RIFT PTS Patch 1.3 In-Progress Notes No.4 - Build 6/18/11

This is something about the RIFT PTS Patch 1.3 In-progress Notes,some of new change,new adds,new service,it would be very helpful for you in upcoming RIFT Patch 1.3. ESTAR is one of the most popular MMO Game Service,of course,we offer RIFT Platinum,if you have a need, come here and Buy Rift Platinum in the lowest price,any needs,you can contact with us,we can do better in the future with your proposal.The following content is RIFT PTS Patch 1.3 In-Progress Notes No.4 - Build 6/18/11.

CHARACTER TRANSFERS

* Character transfers are free and a character can be moved once every 7 days.
* To be eligible for a transfer, your character must meet the following requirements:
- Level 15+ [does not apply to characters on designated Trial Shards]
- If under level 40, the maximum Platinum that you can transfer with is capped at 3 Plat per character level.
- Your account cannot be Coin Locked
- You cannot have mail left in your mailbox, or auctions left on the auction house/pending bids.
* Initiate a Character Transfer from the Character Select screen.
* Not all shards or factions will be open for transfer at a given time; this will change based on population balance.
* If your name is not available on the desired shard, you will be prompted for a rename prior to moving.
* Once you accept the transfer, it will take several seconds to complete.
* For information on transferring your guild [as a guild leader], or joining your guild after it has moved, see below under GUILD TRANSFERS.

GUILD TRANSFERS

* Guild leaders will be able to choose whether or not to move their guild with them to a selected shard after satisfying all of the above transfer process requirements.
* The Guild Bank must be empty for a guild to be eligible for transfer.
* If you are a member of a guild that has moved shards, you will be informed the next time you log in, and the same information will be available on the guild window until you transfer or join another guild. Buy Rift Gold,RIFT Gold hot sale for the cheapest price here.
* If you choose to transfer shards with your guild, the destination shard and faction will always be available to you, even if it is closed to non-guild transfer characters.
* You will need to meet all of the above individual character transfer requirements.
* Once your individual transfer is complete, you will need to seek out a guild leader or officer to be invited to the new version of the guild.

GUILD BANKS

* Guild Banks are now available! Visit the new Guild Bank NPCs in Sanctum and Meridian.
* The first Guild Bank tab can be purchased for 100 Platinum with no additional restrictions.
* Up to 4 additional tabs can also be purchased to expand your guild's bank.
* Guild Banks can also be used to store Platinum, which members of the guild can use to Soul Mend (up to a daily limit) if they have permission to do so.
* A new guild perk, Tithe, generates additional cash drops from NPCs that goes directly into the Guild Bank's cash reserves, up to a daily cap.
* Add and Withdraw permissions for items and currency can be managed for each tab and each guild rank via the Guild interface.
* Coin Locked characters cannot add or remove items or currency from a Guild Bank.
* Authenticator restrictions for Guild Bank management are not included in this release, and will be added in a future update.
* Note: Soulbound or Account-bound items cannot be placed in the Guild Bank.

GENERAL

* PTS ONLY: Increased the rate at which mana regeneration is gained through the Wisdom stat.
* Constant jumping will not cause melee attackers to be out of range for attack.
* Fixed expiration issues with temporary runes - they should now behave as expected.
* Multiple incoming quest-sharing offers will now be properly queued.
* Rifts in the Dunes of Akala, zone events, and event colossi now have a chance to award zone-specific wardrobe items.
* An additional chat message is sent when a guild perk gives you bonus currency.
* Stealth is no longer cancelled when a guild trains the Rift Extraction perk.If you want to Buy Rift Plat,contact with us,Rift Plat sell cheapest and delivered instant.

DUNGEONS, SLIVERS, AND RAIDS
GILDED PROPHECY [Sliver]

* Modified difficulty of several bosses in Gilded Prophecy to make them slightly more forgiving.
* These changes primarily consist of hit point rebalancing, a slight damage output reduction, and modifying ability cooldowns, cast times, or durations.
* No mechanics have been removed.
* We expect this to be an appropriate challenge for people who have not yet completed 20-person raids; feedback is welcomed!

UI/SETTINGS

* The casting bar for spells that cannot be interrupted now has a new appearance and turns orange!
* UI animations for items dropping into your bags no longer queue up and will play immediately instead.
* Fixed an issue with portrait lighting sometimes appearing too dark.

Looking for Group

* Players entering a dungeon instance via LFG will be unable to use the LFG system again for 10 minutes, or until the group defeats the first boss in the instance.
* The first player to quit an LFG group before the instance is completed won't be able to use LFG again for 30 minutes, although it will take pity on groups that have had repeat wipes.
* The Enter/Leave Dungeon option now only works when none of the dungeon party members are in combat.
* The 'Group Formed' popup now displays what kind of group you're forming - Rift, Dungeon, Quest, etc.
* High-level players can use the Specific Dungeon tab to queue for low-level dungeons if they want to assist some lower level players through the instance.
* When leaders queue their group for LFG, each member gets a popup confirmation window for which roles they want to fulfill.
* LFG party leaders who lose a player and miss the initial replacement popup can now open the LFG interface to request another member.

RIFT 1.3 Waves of Madness
Hammerknell. The long-hidden secrets of the accursed Delve stand revealed in RIFT 1.3: Waves of Madness, and you will be able to experience them in an all-new 20-Player Raid. The forsaken Dwarven city has lain silent since the rifts came, sealed by its fleeing inhabitants out of shame for some unspoken crime. The Ascended have long known that something terrible hides in the deeps of the Delve, but before they can raid this abandoned fortress, they must secure its gates and hold back the rising tides of Water and Death.

A dark tide rises
You need not be a scout or spy to notice the Water and Death Rifts that will burst forth across the Telaran sky, or the frenzy of their riftspawn invaders. The Faceless will rush forth as an unstoppable wave of the living and undead. Creatures foul and obscene will smash against the doors of Hammerknell to free a great monstrosity. Learn more about what the forces of the Abyssal and the Endless Court have in store during the Hammerknell Opening Event.

Deep in the Delve
Only when the gates are secured will the Ascended enter Hammerknell, where the anguished wailing of Dwarven ghosts is the very least of horrors. Here, the Defiant and the Guardians will confront the awful truth of the Dwarves’ great crime. Their sin was unspeakable, and for their transgression the Dwarves watched helplessly as their homes were besieged by necrotic hordes, condemned wretches who haunt Hammerknell still. Worse, beyond the Endless Court’s intrusion, the echoes of deep water sound beneath the ruined land. Great treasures await those Ascended who hold tight to their sanity and survive their journey into this most ancient of prisons.

Bank on your comrades
If you plan on raiding Hammerknell, you will need stalwart allies at your side. To help organize your Delve-delving efforts, RIFT 1.3 introduces free character transfers and Guild Banks! Join your companions wherever they may be, and toss your loot into your new Guild Bank to help prepare for the fearsome trials in Hammerknell and beyond.

RIFT 1.3 Character and Guild Transfers (More Details and Inf

RIFT 1.3 Character and Guild Transfers (More Details and Info!)

We are very pleased to be bringing free character and guild transfers with the next update. (RIFT PTS Patch 1.3 In-Progress Notes - Character and Guild Transfer),also be very pleased to offer evert players the cheapest RIFT Platinum,all players Buy Rift Platinum here with 20% - 50% lower price,huge stock for RIFT Gold,Buy Rift Gold with an instant delivery of 10 Mins here!

These transfers are the most recent step towards further optimization of our worlds so we can have even more people playing together on the same shard and in warfronts!

A few weeks ago, we doubled the size of the wargroups allowing you to engage in warfronts faster and with more people!

Last week we updated the hardware on all of our worlds to further increase our overall capacity.

Now, with character and guild transfers, we’re taking the next step towards improving your play experience.

Starting with the RIFT 1.3 Update – Waves of Madness, you will be able to transfer any of your eligible characters to selected shards every seven days … for free!

Here’s a few key points you’ll need to know to get started:

* For most shards, characters must be level 15 or higher and have no mail or auctions to transfer. There is no level limit on trial shards.
* You can transfer FROM any shard.
* If you are a guild leader, you will have the option to transfer your guild with you. (Guild members won't automatically transfer with you.) If you do, the folks you leave behind will be notified where the guild went so they can re-join the guild on the new shard. Characters who transfer to the new shard will automatically be re-joined to their guild at the recruit level.
* Available destination shards will be determined by a combination of total population and current per-faction population. So you’ll see some shards available to transfer as a Defiant that you won’t see on a Guardian; and shards you’ll be able to transfer a Guardian to that you can’t transfer a Defiant to; and there will be lots of shards that any character can transfer to.
* Some shards will be flagged as “Trial” shards. These shards are selected for use in future trial program events, such that we don't end up with large blasts of trial users taking up subscribers' slots, forcing subscribers to queue, as has happened in the past. Non-trial players will not be able to create characters on these shards and subscribers will be notified that they’re on a trial shard when they log in. Characters on Trial servers will be able to transfer off at any level!

Keep in mind that we will be monitoring the activity levels of all wargroups over the next few weeks and will be making adjustments to their composition as appropriate once the initial wave of transfers has settled out.

Rest assured that there is more to come with further shard optimizations and new programs!* We want you to play with your friends and we’re constantly working towards new and better ways to allow more and more people to play together.

We'll have a full step-by-step guide on how to transfer your character and guild tomorrow(6/22/2011)! For now, you can see which shards will be allowed destinations BLOW:

Mage Changes in RIFT 1.3 - Chloromancer Backward Compatibility

Is the Mage Class Going to be Good or Bad in PvP after the 1.3 Soul Changes?

Well, I have to be honest, some people is wondering if mages are going to be the underdogs once again, they used to be bad as hell and then Trion decided to boost all the mage abilities and souls lol! But it looks like after a few months, the mage class needs more fine tuning.

Patch 1.3 changed a lot of things for mages, the Chloromancer and Dominator received so many changes that a free respect was giving to any role with the chloromancer or dominator soul in it. lol! RIFT Platinum,Rift Gold.

Check this page, they have all the the mage changes. Chloromancer and Dominator are insane.

I think the most notorious changes are:

* Corrosion: Fixed a bug where Corrosion could hit through walls and other line of sight-blocking objects.
* Wild Growth: Reduced cooldown to 1 minute, increased radius to 25 meters.
* New ability - Living Infusion: A passive ability that increases the percentage of Life damage converted to healing by Lifegiving Veil by an additional 0.5%, and Lifebound Veil by an additional 1.5%, for each point spent in Chloromancer above 31. Obtained at 32 points in Chloromancer.
* Destructive Growth: Removed branch ability; the effects are now part of the base Wild Growth ability.
* Natural Splendor: Now channels a beam of corrosive energy at the target, dealing Life damage over 8 seconds to the target enemy and up to 8 enemies within 7 meters of the target. Up to 8 allies within 7 meters of the targeted enemy receive healing over 8 seconds. Consumes Charge while active.
* Bloom: Increased healing done.
* Flourish: Reduced healing done.
* New root ability - Natural Healing: Single target heal with a 2.5 second casting time and no additional cooldown. Obtained with 51 points in Chloromancer.

Those are the ones that I think are the changes that actually affected to a certain degree that I can say: "Hey this feels a bit different now!"

Is the Chloromancer Soul Good for PvP?

The Answer is HELL YA AND HELL NO! Why both answers?

Well. if you are in PvP with a group of players around you, Chloromancer can turn the tide of battle in your favor. The more people around you, the more you heal, just keep doing damage to the enemy and from time to time use your direct heals (Bloom, Flourish, etc) to save a friendly in trouble.

Chloromancer used to be like that before and right now is the same thing, remember that Trion rebalanced the soul, but they didn't rebuild it completely, this Soul purpose is the same: Healing Support.

The strategy of Chloromancer in PvP at my point of view is that, stick with your buddies and give them extra time so they can do extra damage, my recommendation is to open up your map window, check out for the main bulk of friendly players and get there as fast as possible, all that people are going to need your healing support abilities soon! By the way, cast your Synthesis ability is on the best player.

What About 1 VS 1 Encounters?

Let me tell you something, if you have the Chloromancer role in you and you have to face someone in 1 vs 1. You are screw!!! You are so Screw! I dunno if any other Chloromancer around the game is good at 1 vs 1 encounter but every time I have to face someone the situation turns to be really bad.

My dps is bad as hell. it builds up very slowly; by the time any DOT does any serious damage I am almost dead, my direct damage abilities are a joke and I can't out heal the damage I take.. It really sucks!

In general, Chloromancer is good for healing support during a boss right in a dungeon or as healing support in the Port of Scion PvP Warfront. Other than that. I found Chloromancer to be very useless!

Clerics should focus on healing and mages on dps. The new Chloromancer tweaks are nothing more than tweaks, fixes and rebalances, but they are not going to change your role and usefulness in the battlefield. In short, Chloromancer is the same thing. Just keep moving, read the patch notes and keep playing, nothing amazing happened here.

Healing is Better Done in a Group. What About Your Strategies and Skill Chains?

To be honest the Chloromancer doesn't have any preset skill chain that you need to cast in that order all the time, the best thing you can do is keep your buffs up all the time, that is not so hard because they are good for 1 hour after you cast them. (Make sure the Lifegiving Veil is up all the time!)

After that, target the monster that everyone is targeting and DOT and nuke it. Dots have different cooldown times and effect times. So keep an eye to see what DoT needs to be reapplied this includes Radiant Spores, Withering Vine or any other dot from the warlock soul tree.

That's right, warlock is a good offsoul if you ask me for Chloromancer. The Key here is DoTs! The more dots, the more damage you do, the more you heal, and remember, reapply the dots that go away as quickly as possible. Get tons of Dots, they really help!

After you have enough Charge, use your Corrosion ability and keep it up all the time as possible, BUT only use Wild Growth if you have tons of charge and your team is in serious trouble! To keep corrosion doing more damage, like a DoT! Because if you ask me Corrosion is like a DoT. You better keep the charge up by using the Stream of Reclamation or Ruin if available and then spam Vile Spores or reapply more DoTs!

RIFT World Event Waves of Madness - Phase 2 Guide

RIFT World Event Waves of Madness - Phase 2 Guide

Since the RIFT Patch 1.3 version has been released,it was much popular and extremely hot,dropped a lot of RIFT Platinum,items,etc! ESTAR keeps to share more useful guides to players.Today we'll share the RIFT World Event Waves of Madness - Phase 2 Guide here.

A few days ago Trion released a big patch for Rift (around 350m. After overcoming a bunch of technical issues and fixing a problem I had with my own computer, I was finally able to check out what exactly happen in Rift and what is new.

Right after logging in, the first thing I notice is that the new World Event moved to stage 2, "Wave of Madness, Phase 2: Against the Storm". If I am not mistaken it looks like the evil watery guy by the name of Hammerknell is getting closer to invade the world with a bunch of his lowlifes minions!

Anyway what exactly is going on in Phase 2? What is new for the players?

Right after logging in, I notice that in Meridian there is a bunch of new quests from the little dwarf friends that are now roaming the inner gardens of the city. RIFT Gold hot on sale,Buy Rift Platinum with 20%-50% lower price,ESTAR provides the safest way to Buy Rift Gold and deliver within 15 Mis!

Quests
'If it Slithers, Kill it' and 'Stopping the flood'
This two are kinda simple, right? It's all about killing water creatures and closing water Rifts, go outside find some water Rifts that are worth XP and kill the creatures around it, or kill water creatures patrolling the land. But closing the rifts is better because you can do two quests in one blow.

These quests have some sense within them because Hammerknell is a water boss (sludge included). I don't know why he haves a grudge with the people playing around the game world, but let's put it in this way... We have watery things to slay!

A small problem I notice with this quest is that if you are level 50, you need to get into the high level places to get water creatures that are worth XP. But if there is currently an event in that place that doesn't involve water creature, like a plane of death invasion, chances are that you won't see any water creature for a while.

Touched by the Rain
This is another quest added in this phase of the event, now there is a bunch of water buckets all around Stillmoor, this looks kinda easy and silly but you have to get a sample of 3 buckets.

Easy? HELL NO!!!!! The buckets are in Stillmoor and both factions have to get this buckets, if you are in a PvP server like me, you are going to have a lot of open world PvP opportunities, the problem is that if you just want to get the buckets and get away, then you are so screw! People are always looking to get your head!

If you want to do this easily, do it in a PvE server or do it before going to work, school, or simply before breakfast, early in the morning. lol! That way you won't get pwned in PvP... Less gankers roaming around in the mornings.

Something Fishy
I am going to be honest here guys, I am not sure if this is a Phase 1 or Phase 2 quest... The reason behind that is that I never saw the quest giver until yesterday(July 4th) lol! That is what happen when dwarfs stay near a bunch of giants, you simply don't see them. At least I don't...

The quest is about using a strange bucket of water to pull out of their costume some crazy ass NPCs that dare to enter Meridian. What I don't understand is how Meridian, the capital city or main outpost of the Defiants doesn't have any kind of machine to detect someone entering the city using a costume.

Let's face the true guys, the Defiants are known to have a bunch of machines and stuff around, that's why the Guardians hate them so much. How in the hell they failed at detecting sneaky mobs? It looks like someone is slacking in the engineering room, let's hope that the guy at the top of the center tower fix this by adding an anti stealth thingy to the big telescope that he is always using.

Note: This quest can be quiet difficult because everyone is doing it. You need to get 7 of those Infiltrator NPCs... Not 1 or 2... 7! At the best I can get 1 or 2 every 20 minutes because a lot of people is getting the other ones before me. The most offensive part is that no one seems to be responding to any kind of grouping request.

Storm Summoner
This event quest will send you all the way up to Moonshade Highlands, the first thing I notice is a big water Rift with no monsters around and a some guy floating in mid air, after a minute I was like, oh well he is having a good time up there, I better move along.

I walked a bit to the left and talked to a friendly dwarf. Guess what! The quest ended. That's it! I was like, ok, what's next? My best guess is that in the next phase we get to kick his sorry floating ass.

Anyway, there are a few details around the place that I need figure out. I am going to be around Rift trying to get a few more planar points and figure out any new secret behind those million fixes the game got in the recent #6 hotfixes patches. lol!

Important Tips
1: Butchering is a gathering profession that goes exceedingly well with Armorsmiths, Apothecary, and Outfitting.

2: You can also use butchering recipes to level up mining skills.

Hide Butchering

Hide Beast Level Comments
Soft Hide lvl 7-14 For Defiants, farm these from shadowtouched wolfs and the smaller wolfs around the shadowtouched. Shadowtouched wolfs yeld 2-4 soft hide, and smaller wolfs give 1-2 soft hide
Thin Hide lvl 15-21 The best place for thin hide is just north or Gloamwood Pines between the two roads on the map. There is a small field there with Darkpaw Snarlers, Darkpaw Prowlers, and Gloam Bats, all drop thin hide and there is a small cave there called Deeproot Fissure where they are as well.

All spawn rather quickly so it is easy to just run around there and pick up a few stacks within a half hour.
Medium Hide mid-20s-level Dropped by rams in ancient valley not boars.

Also dropped by Rotshell Grumbler (in Gloamwood). 4231.2546

Rock Ridge (in Scarlet Gorge) is another good place to farm (if you can stand all the humanoid mobs mixed in, which is trivial at higher levels). 4466,3553.
Heavy Hide lvl 30-32 Iron Fall

Mobs are 30-32 at the start can kill them fairly quickly and get 1-2 hides per Ironfang Stalker
Thick Hide about lvl 37 A great spot for getting thick hides is in Moonshade Highlands there are Ivygrumps at 6450, 1750 level 37 mobs easily killed allot of them nice respawn rate too.
Exotic Hide more than lvl 40 Droughtlands in Carrion Heights, in the bottom right area of the map
Soulhide lvl 48-50 A Good location for farming this would be Stillmoor.

Another location, which is based upon daily spawns, which change every day, would be behind The Chancel of Labors in Iron Pine Peak. This spawn point may be possessed by other monsters... it all depends on the day.
Ironhide lvl 48+ Beasts that require 225 Butchering drop Soulhide and have a chance to give Ironhide

Content
1: Rift PTS: 1.4 In-Progress Notes #1 General
2: Souls - Warrior and Cleric
3: Souls - Rogue and Mage
4: Cult Saga and Zones
5: PvP
6: Items and Crafting
7: Others
GENERAL
* You can now jump into Warfronts while in the LFG queue.
* New items added to your bags (from looting, trading, etc.) are now highlighted in the bag UI the first time they are seen. Once you close the bag for the first time after obtaining a new item, the highlight is removed.
* Souls are now available from your friendly neighborhood Calling trainer. Removed the Soul Quests, although players who currently have these quests will be able to turn them in normally.
* Added a World Defense chat channel to help with coordination of world pvp activity. Characters must be Level 50 and Prestige rank 2 to use this channel; you will be automatically added if you have an open channel slot. If you elect to leave this channel, you will not be automatically returned to it later - eligible characters can join at any time using /join World Defense.
* Using the F1 through F5 keys to target party members in Raids should work more consistently and intuitively.
* Receiving tells while at a loading screen now actually shows you who the tell came from.
QUEST SYSTEM
* Repeatable quests (daily, weekly, etc) no longer count against the 25-quest limit in the quest log.
* Collected quest items that are placed in your bank now count toward the total required for the quest and will be withdrawn when the quest is turned in.
* All characters now have a 'quest bag' attached to their quest log which holds items that are either gained during or required for quests the character is currently on.
* Looted quest items will automatically go into this new quest bag.
* You can move quest items around inside the quest bag or move them into your general inventory if needed.
* Regular items go into inventory bags as usual, and cannot be stored in the quest bag.
GUILDS
* Guild Master NPCs (the ones who sell guild charters in Sanctum and Meridian) now provide an additional service: resetting spent Active or Passive guild perk points for a fee.
* You can now split item stacks, preview items, and link items from within the Guild Bank.
* Some guild quests have been rehauled for better functionality - you'll notice changes in some Dungeon and PvP guild quests.
RIFTS AND INVASIONS
* A number of zone event boss abilities have been slightly reduced in severity and have better warning visuals or casting times added to them.
* Links in chat messages broadcast by zone events now work properly.
COMBAT
* In anticipation of Hammerknell level items entering the game we’ve adjusted certain Combat rating diminishing returns. These changes should only affect fully raid buffed characters in Hammerknell or better equipment.
* Physical Crit, Spell Crit, and Block ratings have both soft and hard caps updated. These caps only affect the bonuses from your base rating and have no effect on percentage-based bonuses from abilities, buffs, and debuffs.
* Physical Crit: Now soft caps at 45%, and the return per point of Physical Crit rating above 45% is reduced. Hard caps at 60%.
* Spell Crit: Now soft caps at 45%, and the return per point of Spell Crit rating above 45% is reduced. Hard caps at 60%.
* Block (Chance to Block): Now soft caps at 40%, and the return per point of Block chance rating after 40% is reduced. Hard caps at 60%.
* Block (Amount Absorbed): Now soft caps at 50%, and the return per point of Block absorption rating after 50% is reduced. Hard caps at 65%.
COMBAT – ITEM PROC RATES
* Item with proc effects (% chance of X on Y) will now be normalized so that the results of an item proc are more consistent regardless of the ability speed or number of targets it hits.
- Abilities that hit multiple targets will trigger procs less than abilities that hit single targets.
- Abilities with longer casting times will trigger procs more often than abilities that are quick to cast.
* Additionally, we've made a pass on the trigger events for procs themselves to make them more consistent across different items.

"Once the shining bastion of Dwarven civilization, today Hammerknell is a symbol of madness and ruin. No one knows what horrors compelled the Dwarves to flee and seal the gates behind them. When asked, they assume shamed expressions and busy themselves with their labors. Now, with Hammeknell's ramparts breached, the Ascended are in a race against the forces of Water and Death to expose the secrets deep within the Delve and save Telara."

With Rift's newest 20-man dungeon on the horizon, Hammerknell has many guilds scrambling to prepare themselves for whats to come. The games newest patch release has brought much hype to the giant encounter loaded with a total of ten bosses. With this being the toughest instance yet for Rift, being geared and prepared is on the agenda.

Water & Death Resistance
Having water and death resistance may not be on the top of the list for must haves when preparing for this next progression raid, but it is important. Having both death and water resist will mitigate the damage from bosses major attacks. It also has the chance for you to actually resist the spell which is something all tanks planning to go into Hammerknell should consider.

Getting the resistance you need is easy. Doing the daily raid rift, whether in a PUG on your server or with your guild, is the best and fastest way to get the inscribed sourcestones you need to purchase essences.

Hit and Focus
Having enough hit and focus is another requirement for Hammerknell. As of now the required hit and focus is at least 300 with the soft cap being at 320. Having this stat as high as possible is important for both tanks and DPS and insure your are able to actually hit the mobs and boss. Anything less that the required will assuredly gimp your damage and threat.

Tier-1 Gear
The most significant factor in predicting your success rate in Hammerknell besides raid composition and ability to work together is raid gear. What Trion is calling tier 1 gear is consisted of Greensale and River of Souls loot. Having cleared both instances and having your raid tier 1 ready is necessary.

Having the ability to work together, tier-1 gear, water and death resistances and the correct amount of hit or focus can make your time in Hammerknell a productive one. Not only will this new addition provide updated gear and weapons but also give new lore and memorable experiences for you and your guild.

Whether your prepared or not Trion's new addition will be substantial. With this being the biggest raid yet, it will provide players with a new challenge. So at any stage of progression you find your guild in, definitely take the time to step foot in what is going to be an experience unlike any other in Telara.

The "Legacy of the Fallen" patch features a new epic quest line called the Water Saga, which is said to reveal the origin of the Abyssal cult. Aimed at high-level Ascended acting alone and in groups, the Water Saga offers both epic loot and a swift and cold-blooded Crocnard Mount.

Along with the new quest comes a new 10-man instance named the Drowned Halls. The Ascended must enter this alternate dimension and stop the faceless sorceress Hydriss from leading her forces into other timelines.

In addition, open world PvP rifts will open. The Warfront of Whitefall Steppes will feature an alternate "Escalation" mission where combatants must race to charge their side's cannon with sourcestone shards issuing from an Air Rift.

Looking for groups will be much easier as the LFG system now works across multiple Shards, swiftly recruiting Ascended to join your quest.

Below is a whole summary about update 1.4:

PvP Rifts: More open-world PvP goodness!
Cross-Shard LFG
Water Saga: Quest line that lets you earn epic loot and a vicious Crocnard Mount
Planar Menace: Stop House Aelfwar and the Abyssal from claiming the Dragon Motes
Drowned Halls: A new 10-player raid sliver
Quest Item Keyring: Save space in your inventory with an extra bag to hold your quest items
New rare materials: New tier of epic materials for each harvesting profession
New crafted item sets: Eight new crafted item sets for dungeon and raid players
Player-crafted augments: Apothecaries can salvage planar essences to make powerful item augments!
And more!

Currently, no official release date has been confirmed for update 1.4.
